Text:
Rose feels her own death is imminent as the naked
blade bears down on her.

With her frail body unable to wield magic, neither
blocking nor evading would be enough to save her.

She can try to twist her torso away to lessen the
damage, but even that movement would be slow
and dull.
It won't be quick enough.

Thinking realistically, death looms before her.
Suddenly, a piercing yell fills the air.
Stoooooop!!!
Something then threw itself into Rose from the side.
No...

There lies the limp, bloody body of a boy. The pool of
blood on the floor slowing growing.
It is a fatal wound.
Eeeeeeek!!!
A scream fills the classroom.

Rose grabs the boy, heedless of the blood. He is
someone she just recently remembers meeting.
Cid Kagenou...
You idiot. Why did you protect me...?

Truth be told, they had only met just recently. They
hadn't even spoken to each other properly yet. There
was no real reason for him to risk his life to save
hers.
Cid!
The boy opens his mouth as if to speak...
*cough, cough*
...and spits out a copious amount of blood.

A smile appears on his blood-smeared face...and then
he draws his last breath. His final expression is one of
a man who has accomplished what he set out to do.
Why...

As she looked at his dead face, Rose felt as if all
the pieces in the puzzle were falling into place.

The abnormally valiant effort he displayed during the
preliminaries. The intense way he looked at her. The
reason why he put himself in harm's way to save
her...
There is a common thread connecting all of it.

Rose was far from stupid. Her status as a princess
and her beauty had attracted romantic interest more
times than she could count from a young age.

But she'd never encountered feelings this fierce. No
one had ever loved her so much that they would give
their life for her.

She will never be able to answer his passion in kind.
But she swears that she will not let it all be for naught.

We're going to the auditorium! Come along quietly if
you don't want to end up like him!
Damn...

Rose lowers her head. She has sworn that she will not
let his feelings have been in vain. Now isn't the time.
Thank you...Cid Kagenou...

The black-clad men begin to move. They force the
students to their feet and lead them from the
room one after another. No one resists.

The last two boys to leave look back at the
classroom.
Cid...
Cid...
Get moving.

The boys are forced out of the room by the men in
black. The sound of their footsteps trails off down
the hall, and silence descends upon the area.

Once I'm certain the classroom is empty, I raise
my fist.
(Beat! Beat!)

I pound my chest over and over, forcing myself to
breathe.
(Beat, damn you!!!)
*cough* *cough, cough*

My previously-stopped heart thumps back to life and
begins to beat again.

I actually pulled it off... My esoteric technique,
the Ten-Minute Death: Heartbreak Mob.

I use magic to operate my circulation, allowing me to
maintain proper blood flow to my brain even while
my heart is stopped...

It's a high-risk technique where one false move could
give me a one-way ticket to the afterlife,

but there's a time when even an extra has to put his
life on the line.

I had avoided a fatal wound, of course, but in order
to make things look convincing, I had allowed the
guy to cut me fairly deep.
My access to magic is still blocked...

But I should be fine if I apply some careful first-
aid. Besides, there'd be no fun in making a total
mockery of my carefully-played trick...
This oughta do it.

Closing the gash completely will take too much time
and cause problems if someone sees me. So I'll
settle for just making sure it won't slow me down.

(I should be good if I just say I miraculously
escaped with my life.)
Okay, guess I'll get moving.

I step from the classroom into the quiet, now-
vacant hallway.

Sherry Barnett was so engrossed in her study of the
artifact that she was late to notice the commotion.
This is...
No way... It couldn't be...

Sherry's pen dances across the paper, her eyes never
leaving the object of her research.

She was completely oblivious to the uproar around
her. The explosions, footsteps in the corridor, and
all the rest of it were outside her awareness.
That's how deeply the artifact holds her attention.

She was always the type to lose sight of everything
around her once she got into her research, but
never quite to this extent.

There has to be something important about this
artifact for it to hold her so raptly.

Those pink eyes are just a step away from unraveling
its mysteries.

But thena window in the laboratory suddenly shatters,
and a lone man climbs in.
Wha...?
We are the Shadow Garden. Or was it Shadow Guardian?
Eh, whatever, I'm Rex. Rex, the Game of Betrayal.

I'm here to collect a pendant-shaped artifact. And
once I have it, I'm free to raise all the hell I want...
Rex's eyes narrow sharply.
*gasp*
Well, that sure makes this easy...
A-Aaah...!
Thanks, girly!
Eek...!
Not on my watch!

When a terrified Sherry opens her eyes again, a large
knight with a lion's mane of hair stands before her
with his sword drawn.
Oho, pretty good for not havin' any magic.
Magic isn't everything.

Parrying is an easy task when my opponent is so
outmatched.

Outmatched...? Don't tell me you seriously think yer
stronger than me, chump.
I do, actually.
Let's hear your name.

Glen, the Lion's Mane, vice commander of the Crimson
Order.
Marco!
Aye!
Sherry, you must leave at once!
What...?!

Sherry bursts into the hallway and runs with
everything she has in her.
Urgh! Gahah!
Vice Commander!
Hahahahaha! Ahahahaha!
What...?!
She hears the screams of the dying echoing behind her.
